trans-unit.target: Og [det er] en meddelelse fra Allah og hans sendebud til folk på dagen for den større pilgrimsfærd, at Allah er løsrevet fra vantro, og [derfor er] Hans Sendebud. Så hvis du angre, der er bedst for dig; men hvis du slå væk - så vide at du ikke vil forårsage svigt til Allah. Og give tidender til dem, der ikke tror på en smertefuld straf.

trans-unit.source: Excepted are those with whom you made a treaty among the polytheists and then they have not been deficient toward you in anything or supported anyone against you; so complete for them their treaty until their term [has ended]. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
trans-unit.target: Undtaget er dem, med hvem du har lavet en traktat mellem polyteister og derefter har de ikke været mangelfuld mod dig i noget eller støttet nogen mod jer; så komplet for dem deres traktaten indtil deres præsidentperiode [har sluttede]. Faktisk elsker Allah de retfærdige, [der frygter ham].

trans-unit.source: And when the sacred months have passed, then kill the polytheists wherever you find them and capture them and besiege them and sit in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they should repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, let them [go] on their way. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Og når de hellige måneder er gået, derefter dræbe polyteister, hvor du finder dem og fange dem og belejre dem og sidde i vente for dem på hvert sted i baghold. Men hvis de skal omvende sig, etablere bøn, og give zakah, lad dem [go] på deres måde. Allah er faktisk Forgiving og barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
trans-unit.target: Og hvis en af polyteister søger din beskyttelse, derefter give ham beskyttelse så han kan høre ord, Allah. Derefter levere ham til hans plads i sikkerhed. Det er fordi de er et folk, der ikke kender.

trans-unit.source: How can there be for the polytheists a treaty in the sight of Allah and with His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at al-Masjid al-Haram? So as long as they are upright toward you, be upright toward them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
trans-unit.target: Hvordan kan der være for polyteister en traktat i synet af Allah og hans sendebud, bortset fra dem, med hvem er du til en traktat på al-Masjid al-Haram? Så længe de er oprejst mod dig, være oprejst mod dem. Faktisk elsker Allah de retfærdige, [der frygter ham].

trans-unit.source: How [can there be a treaty] while, if they gain dominance over you, they do not observe concerning you any pact of kinship or covenant of protection? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Hvordan [kan der være en traktat] mens hvis de får dominans over dig, de ikke overholder angående jer nogen pagt for slægtskab eller pagt beskyttelse? De opfylder du med munden, men deres hjerter nægter [at], og de fleste af dem er trodsigt ulydige.

trans-unit.source: They have exchanged the signs of Allah for a small price and averted [people] from His way. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: De har udvekslet tegn af Allah til en lille pris og afværget [folk] fra hans vej. Faktisk var det onde, som de gjorde.

trans-unit.source: They do not observe toward a believer any pact of kinship or covenant of protection. And it is they who are the transgressors.
trans-unit.target: De overholder ikke mod en tilhænger af nogen pagt for slægtskab eller pagt af beskyttelse. Og det er dem, der er overtræderne.

trans-unit.source: But if they repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.
trans-unit.target: Men hvis de omvender sig, etablere bøn, og give zakah, så de er dine brødre i religion; og vi detalje versene for et folk, der kender.

trans-unit.source: And if they break their oaths after their treaty and defame your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief, for indeed, there are no oaths [sacred] to them; [fight them that] they might cease.
trans-unit.target: Og hvis de bryde deres eder efter deres traktaten og bagvaske din religion, så kæmpe lederne af vantro, for ja, der er ingen eder [hellige] [bekæmpe dem der] de kan ophøre.

trans-unit.source: Would you not fight a people who broke their oaths and determined to expel the Messenger, and they had begun [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right that you should fear Him, if you are [truly] believers.
trans-unit.target: Ville du ikke kæmpe for et folk, der brød deres eder og fast besluttet på at udvise Messenger, og de havde begyndt [angreb på] du første gang? Er du bange for dem? Men Allah har mere ret at du skal frygte ham, hvis du er [virkelig] troende.

trans-unit.source: Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and satisfy the breasts of a believing people
trans-unit.target: Bekæmpe dem; Allah vil straffe dem ved hænderne skændsel dem og give dig sejr over dem og vil tilfredsstille brysterne af en troende mennesker

trans-unit.source: And remove the fury in the believers' hearts. And Allah turns in forgiveness to whom He wills; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Og fjerne raseri i de troendes hjerter. Og Allah vender i tilgivelse som han vil; og Allah er vide og klog.

trans-unit.source: Do you think that you will be left [as you are] while Allah has not yet made evident those among you who strive [for His cause] and do not take other than Allah, His Messenger and the believers as intimates? And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Tror du, at du vil stå tilbage [som du er] mens Allah ikke har endnu gjort klart dem blandt jer, som stræber efter [for hans sag] og tag ikke andet end Allah, hans sendebud og troende som antyder? Og Allah er bekendt med, hvad du gør.

trans-unit.source: It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of Allah [while] witnessing against themselves with disbelief. [For] those, their deeds have become worthless, and in the Fire they will abide eternally.
trans-unit.target: Det er ikke for polyteister at opretholde moskeer i Allah [mens] vidne mod sig selv med vantro. [For] dem, deres gerninger er blevet værdiløse og i ilden de vil forblive evigt.

trans-unit.source: The mosques of Allah are only to be maintained by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and establish prayer and give zakah and do not fear except Allah, for it is expected that those will be of the [rightly] guided.
trans-unit.target: Moskeer i Allah kan kun bevares af dem, der tror på Allah og den yderste dag og etablere bøn og give zakah og frygt ikke undtagen Allah, for det forventes, at de vil være af den [rigtigt] guidede.

trans-unit.source: Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrim and the maintenance of al-Masjid al-Haram equal to [the deeds of] one who believes in Allah and the Last Day and strives in the cause of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Har du gjort levering af vand til pilgrimmen og vedligeholdelse af al-Masjid al-Haram lig med [gerninger], der tror på Allah og den yderste dag og tilstræber i årsagen til Allah? De er ikke lige i synet af Allah. Og Allah guide ikke forseelser mennesker.

trans-unit.source: The ones who have believed, emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are greater in rank in the sight of Allah. And it is those who are the attainers [of success].
trans-unit.target: Dem, der troede, emigrerede og stræbt efter i anledning af Allah med deres rigdom og deres liv er større i rang i synet af Allah. Og det er dem, der er attainers [af succes].

trans-unit.source: Their Lord gives them good tidings of mercy from Him and approval and of gardens for them wherein is enduring pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Deres Herren giver dem gode tidender nåde fra ham og godkendelse og haver for dem hvori er vedvarende glæde.

trans-unit.source: [They will be] abiding therein forever. Indeed, Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: [De bliver] lovlydige deri for evigt. Allah har faktisk med ham en stor belønning.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever does so among you - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: O du, der har troet, tag ikke din fædrene eller dine brødre som allierede hvis de har foretrukket mistro over tro. Og hvem gør det blandt jer - så er det dem, der er lovovertrædere.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have obtained, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than Allah and His Messenger and jihad in His cause, then wait until Allah executes His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people."
trans-unit.target: Sige, [O Muhammad], "hvis jeres fædre, dine sønner, dine brødre, dine hustruer, dine slægtninge, rigdom, som du har fået, handel hvori du frygter tilbagegang, og boliger, som du er glad for er mere elskede dig end Allah og hans Messenger og jihad i hans sag, så vent indtil Allah udfører sin kommando. Og Allah guide ikke trodsigt ulydige folk."

trans-unit.source: Allah has already given you victory in many regions and [even] on the day of Hunayn, when your great number pleased you, but it did not avail you at all, and the earth was confining for you with its vastness; then you turned back, fleeing.
trans-unit.target: Allah har allerede givet dig sejr i mange regioner og [også] på dagen for Hunayn, når din store antal tilfreds du, men det ikke nytte dig på alle, og jorden begrænser for dig med dens enorme mængde; derefter vendte du tilbage, flygter.

trans-unit.source: Then Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers and sent down soldiers angels whom you did not see and punished those who disbelieved. And that is the recompense of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Derefter Allah sendt ned hans ro over hans sendebud og over troende og sendt ned soldater engle hvem du ikke se og straffet dem der disbelieved. Og det er belønning af vantro.

trans-unit.source: Then Allah will accept repentance after that for whom He wills; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Derefter vil Allah acceptere omvendelse efter, for hvem han vil; og Allah er Forgiving og barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, indeed the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this, their [final] year. And if you fear privation, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O du, der har troet, faktisk polyteister er urene, så lad dem ikke tilgang al-Masjid al-Haram efter dette, deres [endelige] år. Og hvis du er bange for afsavn, Allah vil berige dig fra hans dusør hvis han testamenter. Allah er, at vide og klog.

trans-unit.source: Fight those who do not believe in Allah or in the Last Day and who do not consider unlawful what Allah and His Messenger have made unlawful and who do not adopt the religion of truth from those who were given the Scripture - [fight] until they give the jizyah willingly while they are humbled.
trans-unit.target: Bekæmpe dem, der ikke tror på Allah eller på den sidste dag og der ikke betragter ulovlig hvad Allah og hans sendebud har gjort ulovlig, og der ikke vedtager religion af sandheden fra dem, der blev givet Skriften - [kampen] indtil de giver jizyah villigt mens de er ydmyget.

trans-unit.source: The Jews say, "Ezra is the son of Allah "; and the Christians say, "The Messiah is the son of Allah." That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved [before them]. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
trans-unit.target: Jøderne sige, "Ezra er søn af Allah"; og kristne siger, "Messias er søn af Allah." Det er deres udtalelse fra deres mund; de efterligne siger til dem, der disbelieved [før dem]. Allah kan ødelægge dem; Hvordan er de vildledt?

trans-unit.source: They have taken their scholars and monks as lords besides Allah, and [also] the Messiah, the son of Mary. And they were not commanded except to worship one God; there is no deity except Him. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: De har taget deres lærde og munke som lords foruden Allah, og [også] Messias, søn af Mary. Og de blev ikke befalet undtagen for at tilbede én Gud; der er ingen guddom undtagen ham. Ophøjet er han over hvad de forbinder med ham.

trans-unit.source: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah refuses except to perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
trans-unit.target: De ønsker at slukke Allahs lys med deres munde, men Allah nægter undtagen at perfektionere hans lys, selv om vantro ikke kan lide den.

trans-unit.source: It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although they who associate others with Allah dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Det er ham, der har sendte hans budbringer med vejledning og religion i sandhed at manifestere det over al religion, selv om de, der tilknyttes andre Allah ikke kan lide det.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, indeed many of the scholars and the monks devour the wealth of people unjustly and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And those who hoard gold and silver and spend it not in the way of Allah - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: O du, der har troet, faktisk mange af lærde og munkene fortære rigdommen af folk uretfærdigt og afværge [dem] fra måde Allah. Og dem der hamstre guld og sølv og tilbringe det ikke i vejen for Allah - give dem tidender om en smertefuld straf.

trans-unit.source: The Day when it will be heated in the fire of Hell and seared therewith will be their foreheads, their flanks, and their backs, [it will be said], "This is what you hoarded for yourselves, so taste what you used to hoard."
trans-unit.target: Dagen, når det bliver opvarmet i brand af helvede og brændt hermed vil være deres pander, siderne og ryggen, [det vil siges], "Dette er hvad du hamstret for jer selv, så smage hvad du brugte til at hamstre."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the number of months with Allah is twelve [lunar] months in the register of Allah [from] the day He created the heavens and the earth; of these, four are sacred. That is the correct religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the disbelievers collectively as they fight against you collectively. And know that Allah is with the righteous [who fear Him].
trans-unit.target: Faktisk, antallet af måneder med Allah er tolv [lunar] måneder i registret af Allah [fra] den dag, han skabte himlen og jorden; af disse er fire helligt. Det er korrekt religion, så gør ikke forkert jer under dem. Og kampen mod vantro kollektivt som de kæmpe mod dig kollektivt. Og ved, at Allah er med de retfærdige, [der frygter ham].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the postponing [of restriction within sacred months] is an increase in disbelief by which those who have disbelieved are led [further] astray. They make it lawful one year and unlawful another year to correspond to the number made unlawful by Allah and [thus] make lawful what Allah has made unlawful. Made pleasing to them is the evil of their deeds; and Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
trans-unit.target: Faktisk er udskyde [af restriktion i hellige måneder] en stigning i vantro som dem, der har disbelieved er afveje [videre]. De gør det lovligt ét år og ulovlig endnu et år svarer til nummeret gjort ulovlig af Allah og [derfor] foretage lovlig hvad Allah har gjort ulovlige. Lavet behagelig for dem er onde i deres gerninger; og Allah guide ikke mistroiske folk.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, what is [the matter] with you that, when you are told to go forth in the cause of Allah, you adhere heavily to the earth? Are you satisfied with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But what is the enjoyment of worldly life compared to the Hereafter except a [very] little.
trans-unit.target: O du, som har ment, hvad er [der] med dig, når du bliver bedt om at gå frem i årsagen til Allah, du overholder tungt til jorden? Er du tilfreds med livet i denne verden i stedet for hinsidige? Men hvad er nydelsen af verdslige liv i forhold til hinsidige undtagen en [meget] lidt.

trans-unit.source: If you do not go forth, He will punish you with a painful punishment and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all. And Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Hvis du ikke gå tilbage, han vil straffe jer med en smertefuld straf og vil erstatte du med en anden mennesker, og du vil ikke skade ham overhovedet. Og Allah er over alle ting kompetente.

trans-unit.source: If you do not aid the Prophet - Allah has already aided him when those who disbelieved had driven him out [of Makkah] as one of two, when they were in the cave and he said to his companion, "Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us." And Allah sent down his tranquillity upon him and supported him with angels you did not see and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah - that is the highest. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Hvis du ikke støtte profeten - har Allah allerede hjulpet ham da dem der disbelieved havde drevet ham ud [af Makkah] som en af to, når de var i hulen og han sagde til sin kammerat, "ikke bedrøve; Allah er med os." Og Allah sendt ned hans ro over ham og støttede ham med engle du ikke se og lavet af dem, der disbelieved den laveste, mens ordet Allah - ord der er den højeste. Og Allah er ophøjet i Might and Wise.

trans-unit.source: Go forth, whether light or heavy, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the cause of Allah. That is better for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: Gå frem, hvad enten lette eller tunge, og stræber efter med din rigdom og dit liv i årsagen til Allah. Det er bedre for dig, hvis du kun vidste.

trans-unit.source: Had it been an easy gain and a moderate trip, the hypocrites would have followed you, but distant to them was the journey. And they will swear by Allah, "If we were able, we would have gone forth with you," destroying themselves [through false oaths], and Allah knows that indeed they are liars.
trans-unit.target: Havde det været en nem gevinst og en moderat tur, hyklerne ønsker har fulgt jer, men fjern dem var rejsen. Og de vil sværge ved Allah, "Hvis vi kunne, vi ønsker er gået frem med dig," ødelægge sig selv [gennem falske eder], og Allah ved, at de er løgnere.

trans-unit.source: May Allah pardon you, [O Muhammad]; why did you give them permission [to remain behind]? [You should not have] until it was evident to you who were truthful and you knew [who were] the liars.
trans-unit.target: Allah må tilgive dig, [O Muhammad]; Hvorfor du giver dem tilladelse [at forblive bag]? [Du skal ikke have] indtil det blev tydeligt for jer, der var sandfærdig og du vidste [der var] løgnere.

trans-unit.source: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day would not ask permission of you to be excused from striving with their wealth and their lives. And Allah is Knowing of those who fear Him.
trans-unit.target: Dem, der tror på Allah og den sidste dag vil ikke bede om tilladelse af jer til at blive fritaget fra stræber efter med deres rigdom og deres liv. Og Allah er at vide af dem, der frygter ham.

trans-unit.source: Only those would ask permission of you who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day and whose hearts have doubted, and they, in their doubt, are hesitating.
trans-unit.target: Kun de ville bede om tilladelse af jer, der ikke tror på Allah og den sidste dag, og hvis hjerte har tvivlet på, og de, i deres tvivl, tøvende.

trans-unit.source: And if they had intended to go forth, they would have prepared for it [some] preparation. But Allah disliked their being sent, so He kept them back, and they were told, "Remain [behind] with those who remain."
trans-unit.target: Og hvis de havde til hensigt at gå frem, de ville have parat til it [nogle] forberedelse. Men Allah hadede at blive sendt, så han holdt dem tilbage, og de hørte, "Forblive [bag] med dem, der forbliver."

trans-unit.source: Had they gone forth with you, they would not have increased you except in confusion, and they would have been active among you, seeking [to cause] you fitnah. And among you are avid listeners to them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Havde de gået frem med dig, de ville ikke være steget dig undtagen i forvirring, og de ville have været aktive blandt du søger [at give] du fitnah. Og blandt dem er ivrig lyttere til dem. Og Allah er vide i lovovertrædere.

trans-unit.source: They had already desired dissension before and had upset matters for you until the truth came and the ordinance of Allah appeared, while they were averse.
trans-unit.target: De havde allerede ønskede uenighed før og havde forstyrret spørgsmål for dig indtil sandheden kom og bekendtgørelse af Allah dukkede op, mens de var modstander af.

trans-unit.source: And among them is he who says, "Permit me [to remain at home] and do not put me to trial." Unquestionably, into trial they have fallen. And indeed, Hell will encompass the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem er ham, der siger, "Lad mig [til at forblive i hjemmet] og ikke sætte mig til rettergang." Utvivlsomt i retssagen er de faldet. Og ja, helvede vil omfatte vantro.

trans-unit.source: If good befalls you, it distresses them; but if disaster strikes you, they say, "We took our matter [in hand] before," and turn away while they are rejoicing.
trans-unit.target: Hvis god vederfares dig, piner det dem; men hvis katastrofen rammer du, de siger, "Vi tog vores sag [i hånden] før", og drej væk mens de jubler.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Never will we be struck except by what Allah has decreed for us; He is our protector." And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Sige, "aldrig vil vi blive ramt undtagen af hvad Allah har dekreteret for os; Han er vores beskytter." Og ved Allah lad troende stole.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Do you await for us except one of the two best things while we await for you that Allah will afflict you with punishment from Himself or at our hands? So wait; indeed we, along with you, are waiting."
trans-unit.target: Sige, "gør du venter os undtagen én af de to bedste ting mens vi venter for dig at Allah vil hjemsøge dig med straf fra sig selv eller i vores hænder? Så vent; ja venter, sammen med dig, vi."

trans-unit.source: Say, "Spend willingly or unwillingly; never will it be accepted from you. Indeed, you have been a defiantly disobedient people."
trans-unit.target: Siger, "bruger villigt eller modvilligt; aldrig vil det blive accepteret fra dig. Ja, du har været et trodsigt ulydige folk."

trans-unit.source: And what prevents their expenditures from being accepted from them but that they have disbelieved in Allah and in His Messenger and that they come not to prayer except while they are lazy and that they do not spend except while they are unwilling.
trans-unit.target: Og hvad forhindrer deres udgifter i at blive accepteret fra dem, men at de har disbelieved i Allah og hans sendebud, og at de kommer ikke til bøn undtagen mens de er dovne, og at de ikke bruger undtagen mens de er uvillig.

trans-unit.source: So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in worldly life and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Så lad ikke deres rigdom eller deres børn imponere dig. Allah har kun til hensigt at straffe dem gennem dem i verdslige liv, og at deres sjæle bør afvige [i døden] mens de vantro.

trans-unit.source: And they swear by Allah that they are from among you while they are not from among you; but they are a people who are afraid.
trans-unit.target: Og de sværger til Allah, at de er fra jer, mens de ikke er fra jer; men de er et folk, der er bange for.

trans-unit.source: If they could find a refuge or some caves or any place to enter [and hide], they would turn to it while they run heedlessly.
trans-unit.target: Hvis de kunne finde et tilflugtssted eller nogle huler eller et sted at indtaste [og skjule], de vil henvende sig til det mens de løber ukritisk.

trans-unit.source: And among them are some who criticize you concerning the [distribution of] charities. If they are given from them, they approve; but if they are not given from them, at once they become angry.
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem er der nogle der kritisere jer angående [distribution af] velgørende organisationer. Hvis de får fra dem, godkender de; men hvis de ikke får fra dem, på en gang de bliver vred.

trans-unit.source: If only they had been satisfied with what Allah and His Messenger gave them and said, "Sufficient for us is Allah; Allah will give us of His bounty, and [so will] His Messenger; indeed, we are desirous toward Allah," [it would have been better for them].
trans-unit.target: Hvis bare de havde været tilfreds med hvad Allah og hans sendebud gav dem og sagde: "tilstrækkeligt for os er Allah; Allah vil give os af sin bounty, og [så vil] Hans Sendebud; Vi er faktisk nærede mod Allah,"[det ville have været bedre for dem].

trans-unit.source: Zakah expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy and for those employed to collect [zakah] and for bringing hearts together [for Islam] and for freeing captives [or slaves] and for those in debt and for the cause of Allah and for the [stranded] traveler - an obligation [imposed] by Allah. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Zakah udgifter er kun for fattige og til de trængende og for de ansatte til at indsamle [zakah] og samle hjerter [for Islam] og til frigørelse af captivegenforsikringsselskaber [eller slaver], og for dem i gæld og for årsagen til Allah og til [strandede] rejsende - et paabud [] af Allah. Og Allah er vide og klog.

trans-unit.source: And among them are those who abuse the Prophet and say, "He is an ear." Say, "[It is] an ear of goodness for you that believes in Allah and believes the believers and [is] a mercy to those who believe among you." And those who abuse the Messenger of Allah - for them is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem er dem, der misbruger profeten og sige: "han er en øre." Sige, "[det er] en øre af godhed for dig, der tror på Allah og mener, troende og [er] en barmhjertighed til dem, der mener, at blandt du." Og dem, der misbruger den Messenger i Allah - for dem er en smertefuld straf.

trans-unit.source: They swear by Allah to you [Muslims] to satisfy you. But Allah and His Messenger are more worthy for them to satisfy, if they should be believers.
trans-unit.target: De sværger af Allah til dig [muslimer] til at tilfredsstille dig. Men Allah og hans sendebud er mere værd for dem at opfylde, hvis de skal være troende.

trans-unit.source: Do they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - that for him is the fire of Hell, wherein he will abide eternally? That is the great disgrace.
trans-unit.target: Ved de ikke, at den, der modsætter sig Allah og hans sendebud - det for ham er brand af helvede, hvori han vil forblive evigt? Det er den store skandale.

trans-unit.source: They hypocrites are apprehensive lest a surah be revealed about them, informing them of what is in their hearts. Say, "Mock [as you wish]; indeed, Allah will expose that which you fear."
trans-unit.target: De hyklere er ængstelig, lest afsløres en Sura om dem, informere dem om hvad der er i deres hjerter. Sige, "Mock [som du ønsker]; faktisk, Allah vil afsløre det, som du er bange for."

trans-unit.source: And if you ask them, they will surely say, "We were only conversing and playing." Say, "Is it Allah and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking?"
trans-unit.target: Og hvis du spørger dem, de vil sikkert sige, "vi kun samtale og spille." Sige, "Er det Allah og hans vers og hans sendebud, som du spottende?"

trans-unit.source: Make no excuse; you have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon one faction of you - We will punish another faction because they were criminals.
trans-unit.target: Gøre ingen undskyldning; du har disbelieved efter din overbevisning. Hvis vi benåde en fraktion af du - vil vi straffe en anden fraktion, fordi de var forbrydere.

trans-unit.source: The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right and close their hands. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them [accordingly]. Indeed, the hypocrites - it is they who are the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Hykler mænd og hykler kvinder er af en anden. De pålægger hvad der er galt og forbyde, hvad der er rigtigt og lukke deres hænder. De har glemt Allah, så han har glemt dem [derfor]. Faktisk, hyklere - det er dem, der er trodsigt ulydige.

trans-unit.source: Allah has promised the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the disbelievers the fire of Hell, wherein they will abide eternally. It is sufficient for them. And Allah has cursed them, and for them is an enduring punishment.
trans-unit.target: Allah har lovet hykler mænd og hykler kvinder og vantro brand af helvede, hvori de vil forblive evigt. Det er tilstrækkeligt for dem. Og Allah har forbandet dem, og for dem er en varig straf.

trans-unit.source: [You disbelievers are] like those before you; they were stronger than you in power and more abundant in wealth and children. They enjoyed their portion [of worldly enjoyment], and you have enjoyed your portion as those before you enjoyed their portion, and you have engaged [in vanities] like that in which they engaged. [It is] those whose deeds have become worthless in this world and in the Hereafter, and it is they who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: [Du vantro er] som dem før du; de var stærkere end du i magt og mere rigelige i rigdom og børn. De nød deres del [af verdslige nydelse], og du har nydt din del som dem, før du har nydt deres del, og du har engageret [i forfængelighed] gerne, at i som de forlovet. [Det er] dem hvis gerninger er blevet værdiløse i denne verden og hinsidige, og det er dem, som er taberne.

trans-unit.source: Has there not reached them the news of those before them - the people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Madyan and the towns overturned? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: Der ikke har nået dem nyheden om dem før dem - folk Noah og [tribes af]» ald og Thamud og folk af Abraham og kammerater i Madyan og byerne væltet? Deres budbringere kom til dem med klare beviser. Og Allah vil aldrig har krænket dem, men de gøre selv.

trans-unit.source: The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. Those - Allah will have mercy upon them. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: De troende mænd og kvinder, troende er allierede med hinanden. De pålægger hvad der er rigtigt og forbyde, hvad der er galt og etablere bøn og give zakah og adlyder Allah og hans sendebud. Dem - Allah vil have barmhjertighed med dem. Faktisk, Allah er ophøjet i Might and Wise.

trans-unit.source: Allah has promised the believing men and believing women gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence; but approval from Allah is greater. It is that which is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Allah har lovet at tro mænd og tro, at kvinder haver under hvilke floder flow, hvori de overholder evigt, og behagelige boliger i haver evig bopæl; men godkendelse fra Allah er større. Det er, at der er stor opfyldelsen.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, fight against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: O profet, kampen mod vantro og hyklerne og være barske på dem. Deres tilflugt er helvede, og elendige er destinationen.

trans-unit.source: They swear by Allah that they did not say [anything against the Prophet] while they had said the word of disbelief and disbelieved after their [pretense of] Islam and planned that which they were not to attain. And they were not resentful except [for the fact] that Allah and His Messenger had enriched them of His bounty. So if they repent, it is better for them; but if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And there will not be for them on earth any protector or helper.
trans-unit.target: De sværger ved Allah, at de ikke siger [noget mod profeten] mens de havde sagt ord af vantro og disbelieved efter deres [forstillelse af] Islam og planlagt det, som de ikke skulle nå. Og de var ikke krænket undtagen [fordi] at Allah og hans sendebud havde beriget dem af hans bounty. Så hvis de omvender sig, det er bedre for dem; men hvis de vender væk, Allah vil straffe dem med en smertefuld straf i denne verden og hinsidige. Og der vil ikke være for dem på jorden en protector eller helper.

trans-unit.source: And among them are those who made a covenant with Allah, [saying], "If He should give us from His bounty, we will surely spend in charity, and we will surely be among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem er dem, der gjorde en pagt med Allah, [siger], "Hvis han skulle give os fra sin bounty, vi vil helt sikkert bruge i velgørenhed, og vi vil helt sikkert være blandt retfærdige."

trans-unit.source: But when he gave them from His bounty, they were stingy with it and turned away while they refused.
trans-unit.target: Men når han gav dem fra sin bounty, de var nærig med det og vendte væk mens de nægtede.

trans-unit.source: So He penalized them with hypocrisy in their hearts until the Day they will meet Him - because they failed Allah in what they promised Him and because they [habitually] used to lie.
trans-unit.target: Så han straffet dem med hykleri i deres hjerter indtil dag vil de mødes med ham - fordi de ikke Allah i hvad de har lovet ham, og fordi de [sædvanligvis] bruges til at ligge.

trans-unit.source: Did they not know that Allah knows their secrets and their private conversations and that Allah is the Knower of the unseen?
trans-unit.target: Vidste de ikke, at Allah ved deres hemmeligheder og deres private samtaler og at Allah er Knower af usete?

trans-unit.source: Those who criticize the contributors among the believers concerning [their] charities and [criticize] the ones who find nothing [to spend] except their effort, so they ridicule them - Allah will ridicule them, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Dem, der kritiserer bidragydere blandt de troende om [deres] velgørende og kritisere dem, der finde noget [at tilbringe] undtagen deres indsats, så de latterliggøre dem - Allah vil latterliggøre dem og de vil få en smertelig straf.

trans-unit.source: Ask forgiveness for them, [O Muhammad], or do not ask forgiveness for them. If you should ask forgiveness for them seventy times - never will Allah forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Bede om tilgivelse for dem, [O Muhammad], eller ikke beder om tilgivelse herfor. Hvis du skal bede tilgivelse for dem halvfjerds gange - aldrig vil Allah tilgive dem. Det er fordi de disbelieved i Allah og hans sendebud, og Allah ikke guide trodsigt ulydige folk.

trans-unit.source: Those who remained behind rejoiced in their staying [at home] after [the departure of] the Messenger of Allah and disliked to strive with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah and said, "Do not go forth in the heat." Say, "The fire of Hell is more intensive in heat" - if they would but understand.
trans-unit.target: Dem, der forblev bag jublede i deres blive [hjemme] efter [afgang] den Messenger i Allah og uglesete for at kæmpe med deres rigdom og deres liv i årsagen til Allah og sagde: "Ikke går frem i varmen." Sige, "brand af helvede er mere intensivt i varmen" -, hvis de ville men forstår.

trans-unit.source: So let them laugh a little and [then] weep much as recompense for what they used to earn.
trans-unit.target: Så lad dem grine lidt og [så] græder meget som belønning for hvad de bruges til at tjene.

trans-unit.source: If Allah should return you to a faction of them [after the expedition] and then they ask your permission to go out [to battle], say, "You will not go out with me, ever, and you will never fight with me an enemy. Indeed, you were satisfied with sitting [at home] the first time, so sit [now] with those who stay behind."
trans-unit.target: Hvis Allah bør vende tilbage til en fraktion af dem [efter ekspeditionen] og derefter de bede om din tilladelse til at gå [til slaget], sige, "du ikke vil gå ud med mig, nogensinde, og du vil aldrig kæmpe med mig en fjende. Ja, du var tilfreds med sidder [hjemme] første gang, så sidder [nu] med dem, der bo bag. "

trans-unit.source: And do not pray [the funeral prayer, O Muhammad], over any of them who has died - ever - or stand at his grave. Indeed, they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Og beder ikke [i begravelsen bøn, O Muhammad], over nogen af dem, der er død - nogensinde- eller stå på hans grav. Faktisk er de disbelieved i Allah og hans sendebud og døde mens de var trodsigt ulydige.

trans-unit.source: And let not their wealth and their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in this world and that their souls should depart [at death] while they are disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Og lad ikke deres rigdom og deres børn imponere dig. Allah har kun til hensigt at straffe dem gennem dem i denne verden, og at deres sjæle bør afvige [i døden] mens de vantro.

trans-unit.source: And when a surah was revealed [enjoining them] to believe in Allah and to fight with His Messenger, those of wealth among them asked your permission [to stay back] and said, "Leave us to be with them who sit [at home]."
trans-unit.target: Og når en Sura blev afsløret [pålægger dem] tror på Allah og kæmpe med hans sendebud, dem af rigdom blandt dem bedt om din tilladelse [at bo tilbage] og sagde: "Lad os for at være sammen med dem, der sidder [hjemme]."

trans-unit.source: They were satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and their hearts were sealed over, so they do not understand.
trans-unit.target: De var tilfredse med dem, der bo bag, og deres hjerter blev forseglet over, så de ikke forstår.

trans-unit.source: But the Messenger and those who believed with him fought with their wealth and their lives. Those will have [all that is] good, and it is those who are the successful.
trans-unit.target: Men Messenger og dem, der menes med ham kæmpede med deres rigdom og deres liv. De vil have [alle thats] gode, og det er dem, der er den succesfulde.

trans-unit.source: Allah has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Allah har forberedt til dem haver under hvilke floder flow, hvori de vil forblive evigt. Der er stor opfyldelsen.

trans-unit.source: And those with excuses among the bedouins came to be permitted [to remain], and they who had lied to Allah and His Messenger sat [at home]. There will strike those who disbelieved among them a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Dem med undskyldninger blandt beduinerne kom tillades [at forblive], og de, der havde løjet til Allah og hans sendebud sad [hjemme]. Der vil slå dem, der disbelieved blandt dem en smertefuld straf.

trans-unit.source: There is not upon the weak or upon the ill or upon those who do not find anything to spend any discomfort when they are sincere to Allah and His Messenger. There is not upon the doers of good any cause [for blame]. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Der er ikke efter svage eller syge eller for dem, der ikke kan finde noget at bruge ubehag, når de er oprigtige til Allah og hans sendebud. Der er ikke efter magtsyge af gode nogen årsag [for skylden]. Og Allah er Forgiving og barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: Nor [is there blame] upon those who, when they came to you that you might give them mounts, you said, "I can find nothing for you to ride upon." They turned back while their eyes overflowed with tears out of grief that they could not find something to spend [for the cause of Allah].
trans-unit.target: Heller ikke [er der bebrejder] over dem, der når de kom til dig, at du kan give dem mounts, du sagde, "Jeg kan finde noget for dig at ride på." De vendte tilbage mens der opstod overløb i deres øjne med tårer ud af sorg, som de ikke kunne finde noget at bruge [for årsagen til Allah].

trans-unit.source: The cause [for blame] is only upon those who ask permission of you while they are rich. They are satisfied to be with those who stay behind, and Allah has sealed over their hearts, so they do not know.
trans-unit.target: Årsag [for skylden] er kun for dem, der beder tilladelse fra dig, mens de er rige. De er tilfredse med dem, der bo bag, og Allah har forseglet over deres hjerter, så de ikke kender.

trans-unit.source: They will make excuses to you when you have returned to them. Say, "Make no excuse - never will we believe you. Allah has already informed us of your news. And Allah will observe your deeds, and [so will] His Messenger; then you will be taken back to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: De vil gøre undskyldninger til dig, når du er vendt tilbage til dem. Sige, "gøre ingen undskyldning - aldrig vil vi tro dig. Allah har allerede informeret os om din nyheder. Og Allah vil observere dine gerninger, og [så] Hans Sendebud; så du vil blive ført tilbage til Knower af usete og de vidne, og han vil informere dig om hvad du plejede at gøre."

trans-unit.source: They will swear by Allah to you when you return to them that you would leave them alone. So leave them alone; indeed they are evil; and their refuge is Hell as recompense for what they had been earning.
trans-unit.target: De vil sværge ved Allah til dig når du vender tilbage til dem, du ville lade dem alene. Så lade dem alene; de er onde; og deres tilflugt er helvede som belønning for hvad de havde været at tjene.

trans-unit.source: They swear to you so that you might be satisfied with them. But if you should be satisfied with them - indeed, Allah is not satisfied with a defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: De sværger til dig så at du kan være tilfreds med dem. Men hvis du bør være tilfreds med dem - faktisk, Allah er tilfreds ikke med et trodsigt ulydige folk.

trans-unit.source: The bedouins are stronger in disbelief and hypocrisy and more likely not to know the limits of what [laws] Allah has revealed to His Messenger. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Beduinerne er stærkere i vantro og hykleri og mere sandsynligt ikke at kende grænserne for hvad [love] Allah har åbenbaret for hans sendebud. Og Allah er vide og klog.

trans-unit.source: And among the bedouins are some who consider what they spend as a loss and await for you turns of misfortune. Upon them will be a misfortune of evil. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Og blandt beduinerne er nogle, der mener, hvad de bruger som et tab og venter til du vender af ulykke. Dem vil være en ulykke for ondskab. Og Allah er hørelse og vide.

trans-unit.source: But among the bedouins are some who believe in Allah and the Last Day and consider what they spend as means of nearness to Allah and of [obtaining] invocations of the Messenger. Unquestionably, it is a means of nearness for them. Allah will admit them to His mercy. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Men blandt beduinerne er nogle, der tror på Allah og den yderste dag og overveje, hvad de bruger som middel til nærhed til Allah og [at] påkaldelser af Messenger. Utvivlsomt, det er et middel til nærhed for dem. Allah vil indrømme dem til hans nåde. Allah er faktisk Forgiving og barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: And the first forerunners [in the faith] among the Muhajireen and the Ansar and those who followed them with good conduct - Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and He has prepared for them gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Og de første forløberne [i troen] blandt Muhajireen og Ansar og dem, der fulgte dem med god adfærd - Allah er tilfreds med dem og de er tilfredse med ham, og han har forberedt til dem haver under hvilke floder flow, hvori de vil holde for evigt. Der er stor opfyldelsen.

trans-unit.source: And among those around you of the bedouins are hypocrites, and [also] from the people of Madinah. They have become accustomed to hypocrisy. You, [O Muhammad], do not know them, [but] We know them. We will punish them twice [in this world]; then they will be returned to a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem omkring dig af beduinerne er hyklere, og [også] fra folk af Madinah. De har vænnet sig til hykleri. Du, [O Muhammad], kender ikke dem, [men] vi kender dem. Vi vil straffe dem to gange [i denne verden]; derefter vil de være vendte tilbage til en stor straf.

trans-unit.source: And [there are] others who have acknowledged their sins. They had mixed a righteous deed with another that was bad. Perhaps Allah will turn to them in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Og [der er] andre, der har erkendt deres synder. De havde blandet et retfærdige gerning med en anden, der var dårlig. Måske vil Allah slå dem i tilgivelse. Allah er faktisk Forgiving og barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: Take, [O, Muhammad], from their wealth a charity by which you purify them and cause them increase, and invoke [Allah 's blessings] upon them. Indeed, your invocations are reassurance for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Tage, [O, Muhammad], fra deres rigdom velgørenhed som du rense dem og få dem stige, og påberåbe sig [Allahs velsignelser] på dem. Ja, din starterne er tryghed for dem. Og Allah er hørelse og vide.

trans-unit.source: Do they not know that it is Allah who accepts repentance from His servants and receives charities and that it is Allah who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful?
trans-unit.target: Ved de ikke, at det er Allah, der accepterer omvendelse fra hans tjenere og modtager velgørende organisationer og at det er Allah, der er accept af anger, barmhjertige?

trans-unit.source: And say, "Do [as you will], for Allah will see your deeds, and [so, will] His Messenger and the believers. And you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Og sige, "gøre [som vil], for Allah vil se dine gerninger, og [så] hans Messenger og troende. Og du vil blive returneret til Knower af usete og de vidne, og han vil informere dig om hvad du plejede at gøre."

trans-unit.source: And [there are] others deferred until the command of Allah - whether He will punish them or whether He will forgive them. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Og [der er] andre udskudt indtil kommando af Allah - om han vil straffe dem, eller om han vil tilgive dem. Og Allah er vide og klog.

trans-unit.source: And [there are] those [hypocrites] who took for themselves a mosque for causing harm and disbelief and division among the believers and as a station for whoever had warred against Allah and His Messenger before. And they will surely swear, "We intended only the best." And Allah testifies that indeed they are liars.
trans-unit.target: Og [der er] disse [hyklere] der tog sig en moske for at forårsage skade og vantro og division blandt troende og som en station for hvem havde stred mod Allah og hans sendebud før. Og de vil sikkert sværger, "Vi bestemt kun bedst." Og Allah vidner, at de er løgnere.

trans-unit.source: Do not stand [for prayer] within it - ever. A mosque founded on righteousness from the first day is more worthy for you to stand in. Within it are men who love to purify themselves; and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
trans-unit.target: Stå ikke [for bøn] inden for it - nogensinde. En moske, grundlagt på retfærdighed fra den første dag er mere værd for dig at stå. Inden for det er mænd, der elsker at rense sig selv; og Allah elsker dem, der renser sig selv.

trans-unit.source: Then is one who laid the foundation of his building on righteousness [with fear] from Allah and [seeking] His approval better or one who laid the foundation of his building on the edge of a bank about to collapse, so it collapsed with him into the fire of Hell? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Derefter er der lagt grundlaget for hans bygning på retfærdighed [med frygt] fra Allah og [søger] hans godkendelse bedre eller en, der lagde grundlaget for hans bygning på kanten af en bank ved at bryde sammen, så det kollapsede med ham ind i branden i helvede? Og Allah guide ikke forseelser mennesker.

trans-unit.source: Their building which they built will not cease to be a [cause of] skepticism in their hearts until their hearts are stopped. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Deres bygning, som de byggede vil ikke ophøre med at være en [årsag] skepsis i deres hjerter, indtil deres hjerte er stoppet. Og Allah er vide og klog.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties [in exchange] for that they will have Paradise. They fight in the cause of Allah, so they kill and are killed. [It is] a true promise [binding] upon Him in the Torah and the Gospel and the Qur'an. And who is truer to his covenant than Allah? So rejoice in your transaction which you have contracted. And it is that which is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Faktisk, Allah har købt fra troende deres liv og deres egenskaber [i exchange] for at de vil have paradis. De kæmper i årsagen til Allah, så de dræbe og dræbes. [Det er] en sande løfte [bindende] ham i Toraen og evangeliet og Koranen. Og hvem er sandere til sin pagt end Allah? Så Glæd dig ved din transaktion, som du har indgået. Og det er at der er stor opfyldelsen.

trans-unit.source: [Such believers are] the repentant, the worshippers, the praisers [of Allah], the travelers [for His cause], those who bow and prostrate [in prayer], those who enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and those who observe the limits [set by] Allah. And give good tidings to the believers.
trans-unit.target: [Sådanne troende er] den angrende, tilbedere, praisers [i Allah], rejsende [for hans årsag], dem, der bøjer og næsegrus [i bøn], dem, der pålægger hvad der er rigtigt og forbyde, hvad der er galt, og dem, der overholder grænserne [sæt af] Allah. Og give gode tidender for troende.

trans-unit.source: It is not for the Prophet and those who have believed to ask forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they were relatives, after it has become clear to them that they are companions of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Det er ikke for profeten og dem, der har troet at bede om tilgivelse for polyteister, selv om de var slægtninge, efter det er blevet klart for dem at de er kammerater i Hellfire.

trans-unit.source: And the request of forgiveness of Abraham for his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became apparent to Abraham that his father was an enemy to Allah, he disassociated himself from him. Indeed was Abraham compassionate and patient.
trans-unit.target: Og anmodning af tilgivelse af Abraham for hans far var kun på grund af et løfte, han havde gjort for ham. Men da det blev klart for Abraham, at hans far var en fjende af Allah, han fralagde sig fra ham. Faktisk var Abraham medfølende og patient.

trans-unit.source: And Allah would not let a people stray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should avoid. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Og Allah ville ikke lade et omstrejfende folk, efter at han har styret dem, indtil han gør klar til dem hvad de bør undgå. Allah er faktisk vide af alle ting.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He gives life and causes death. And you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper.
trans-unit.target: Faktisk tilhører Allah herredømme af himlene og jorden; Han giver liv og forårsager død. Og du har ikke udover Allah nogen protector eller enhver helper.

trans-unit.source: Allah has already forgiven the Prophet and the Muhajireen and the Ansar who followed him in the hour of difficulty after the hearts of a party of them had almost inclined [to doubt], and then He forgave them. Indeed, He was to them Kind and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Allah har allerede tilgivet profeten og Muhajireen og den Ansar, som fulgte ham i timen sværhedsgrad efter hjerter af en part af dem havde næsten tilbøjelig [at tvivle] og derefter han tilgav dem. Han var faktisk dem form og barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: And [He also forgave] the three who were left behind [and regretted their error] to the point that the earth closed in on them in spite of its vastness and their souls confined them and they were certain that there is no refuge from Allah except in Him. Then He turned to them so they could repent. Indeed, Allah is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Og [han også tilgav] de tre, der blev efterladt [og fortrudt deres fejl] til det punkt at jorden lukket sig om dem på trods af sin enorme mængde og deres sjæle begrænset dem og de var sikker på, at der er ingen tilflugt fra Allah undtagen i ham. Derefter vendte han sig til dem så de kan omvende. Allah er accept af anger, barmhjertige.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah and be with those who are true.
trans-unit.target: O du, der har troet, frygte Allah og være sammen med dem, der er sande.

trans-unit.source: It was not [proper] for the people of Madinah and those surrounding them of the bedouins that they remain behind after [the departure of] the Messenger of Allah or that they prefer themselves over his self. That is because they are not afflicted by thirst or fatigue or hunger in the cause of Allah, nor do they tread on any ground that enrages the disbelievers, nor do they inflict upon an enemy any infliction but that is registered for them as a righteous deed. Indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Det var ikke [ordentlig] for befolkningen i Madinah og dem, der omgiver dem af beduinerne, de forblive bag efter [afgang] den Messenger i Allah, eller at de foretrækker sig over hans self. Det er fordi de ikke er plaget af tørst, træthed eller sult i årsagen til Allah, og heller ikke gøre de slidbane på grund af der enrages vantro, og heller ikke gøre de påføre på en fjende enhver udsættelse men der er registreret for dem som en retfærdige gerning. Faktisk tillader Allah ikke at blive tabt belønning af magtsyge af god.

trans-unit.source: Nor do they spend an expenditure, small or large, or cross a valley but that it is registered for them that Allah may reward them for the best of what they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Heller ikke gøre de tilbringe en udgift, små eller store, eller krydse en dal, men at det er registreret for dem at Allah kan belønne dem til bedst af hvad de gjorde.

trans-unit.source: And it is not for the believers to go forth [to battle] all at once. For there should separate from every division of them a group [remaining] to obtain understanding in the religion and warn their people when they return to them that they might be cautious.
trans-unit.target: Og det er ikke for de troende til at gå videre [at slaget] på én gang. Der bør adskille fra hver division af dem en gruppe [tilbage] til at opnå forståelse i religion og advare deres folk, når de vender tilbage til dem at de kunne være forsigtige.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fight those adjacent to you of the disbelievers and let them find in you harshness. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
trans-unit.target: O finde du, som har ment, bekæmpe de tilstødende til dig af vantro og lad dem i du hårdheden. Og ved, at Allah er med retfærdige.

trans-unit.source: And whenever a surah is revealed, there are among the hypocrites those who say, "Which of you has this increased faith?" As for those who believed, it has increased them in faith, while they are rejoicing.
trans-unit.target: Og hver gang et Sura er afsløret, er der blandt hyklerne dem, der siger, "Som om du har denne øget tro?" Som for dem, der mente, er det steget dem i tro, mens de jubler.

trans-unit.source: But as for those in whose hearts is disease, it has [only] increased them in evil [in addition] to their evil. And they will have died while they are disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Men for dem, i hvis hjerter er sygdom, det er [kun] steget dem i onde [endvidere] til deres onde. Og de vil være døde, mens de er vantro.

trans-unit.source: Do they not see that they are tried every year once or twice but then they do not repent nor do they remember?
trans-unit.target: Kan de ikke se at de er forsøgt hvert år en eller to gange, men derefter de omvender sig ikke heller kan de huske?

trans-unit.source: And whenever a surah is revealed, they look at each other, [saying], "Does anyone see you?" and then they dismiss themselves. Allah has dismissed their hearts because they are a people who do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Og hver gang et Sura er afsløret, de ser på hinanden, [siger], "Nogen ser du?" og derefter de afvise selv. Allah har afvist deres hjerter, fordi de er et folk, der ikke forstår.

trans-unit.source: There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer; [he is] concerned over you and to the believers is kind and merciful.
trans-unit.target: Der er sikkert kommet til dig en Messenger blandt jer selv. Grievous til ham er, hvad du lider; [han er] berørt over dig og troende er venlig og barmhjertig.

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad], say, "Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne."
trans-unit.target: Men hvis de vender væk, [O Muhammad], siger, "tilstrækkeligt for mig er Allah; der er ingen guddom undtagen ham. Ham har jeg lagt, og han er herre i den store trone."

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the wise Book
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Ra. Disse er versene af den kloge bog

trans-unit.source: Have the people been amazed that We revealed [revelation] to a man from among them, [saying], "Warn mankind and give good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their Lord"? [But] the disbelievers say, "Indeed, this is an obvious magician."
trans-unit.target: Har folk været forbløffet over, at vi viste [åbenbaring] til en mand blandt dem, [siger], "Advarer menneskeheden og give gode tidender til dem, der tror, at de får en [fast] forrang for ære med deres Herre"? [Men] vantro siger, "Ja, det er en indlysende tryllekunstner."

trans-unit.source: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne, arranging the matter [of His creation]. There is no intercessor except after His permission. That is Allah, your Lord, so worship Him. Then will you not remember?
trans-unit.target: Ja, jeres Herre er Allah, der skabte himlen og jorden i seks dage og derefter etableret sig over trone, at arrangere spørgsmålet [om hans skabelse]. Der er ingen forbeder undtagen efter hans tilladelse. Det er Allah, jeres Herre, så tilbede ham. Så vil du ikke huske?

trans-unit.source: To Him is your return all together. [It is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. Indeed, He begins the [process of] creation and then repeats it that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds, in justice. But those who disbelieved will have a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment for what they used to deny.
trans-unit.target: For ham er din tilbagevenden alle sammen. [Det er] løftet om Allah, [der er] sandheden. Faktisk, han begynder [proces af] oprettelsen og derefter gentager det at han kan belønne dem, der har ment og gjort retfærdige gerninger, i retfærdighed. Men dem, der disbelieved vil have en drink for skoldning vand og en smertefuld straf for hvad de plejede at benægte.

trans-unit.source: It is He who made the sun a shining light and the moon a derived light and determined for it phases - that you may know the number of years and account [of time]. Allah has not created this except in truth. He details the signs for a people who know
trans-unit.target: Det er ham, der gjorde solen et skinnende lys, og Månen en afledt lys og beslutsom for det faser - så du kan kende antallet år og hensyn [tid]. Allah har ikke oprettet dette bortset fra sandhed. Han beskriver i detaljer tegnene for et folk, der kender

trans-unit.source: Indeed, in the alternation of the night and the day and [in] what Allah has created in the heavens and the earth are signs for a people who fear Allah
trans-unit.target: Faktisk, i skiftevis nat og dag og [i] hvad Allah har skabt i himlene og jorden er tegn for et folk, der frygter Allah

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel secure therein and those who are heedless of Our signs
trans-unit.target: Ja, dem, der forventer ikke møde med os og er tilfredse med livet i denne verden og føle sig trygge deri og dem, der er ubekymrede om vores skilte

trans-unit.source: For those their refuge will be the Fire because of what they used to earn.
trans-unit.target: For dem bliver deres tilflugt ilden på grund af hvad de bruges til at tjene.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - their Lord will guide them because of their faith. Beneath them rivers will flow in the Gardens of Pleasure
trans-unit.target: Ja, dem, der har ment og gjort retfærdige gerninger - deres Herren vil vejlede dem på grund af deres tro. Beneath vil dem floder flyde i haver fornøjelse

trans-unit.source: Their call therein will be, "Exalted are You, O Allah," and their greeting therein will be, "Peace." And the last of their call will be, "Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds!"
trans-unit.target: Deres opkald deri vil være, "Ophøjet er du, O Allah", og deres hilsen deri vil være, "Fred." Og sidst af deres opkald vil være, "Ros til Allah, Herren of the worlds!"

trans-unit.source: And if Allah was to hasten for the people the evil [they invoke] as He hastens for them the good, their term would have been ended for them. But We leave the ones who do not expect the meeting with Us, in their transgression, wandering blindly
trans-unit.target: Og hvis Allah var at fremskynde for mennesker, det onde, [de påberåbe sig] som han skynder sig for dem. gode, deres sigt ville have været afsluttet for dem. Men vi lader dem, der ikke forventer møde med os, i deres overtrædelse, vandre blindt

trans-unit.source: And when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, whether lying on his side or sitting or standing; but when We remove from him his affliction, he continues [in disobedience] as if he had never called upon Us to [remove] an affliction that touched him. Thus is made pleasing to the transgressors that which they have been doing
trans-unit.target: Og når lidelse rører mand, han kalder på os, om liggende på sin side eller siddende eller stående; men når vi fjerner fra ham hans lidelse, fortsætter han [i ulydighed] som hvis han havde aldrig opfordret os til at fjerne en lidelse, som rørte ham. Således er lavet glædeligt at overtræderne, som de har gjort

trans-unit.source: And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus do We recompense the criminal people
trans-unit.target: Og vi var allerede ødelagt generationer før du når de forurettet, og deres budbringere var kommet til dem med klare beviser, men de var ikke til at tro. Dermed vi gengælde den kriminelle mennesker

trans-unit.source: Then We made you successors in the land after them so that We may observe how you will do.
trans-unit.target: Så lavede vi du efterfølgere i landet efter dem således at vi kan observere, hvordan du vil gøre.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
trans-unit.target: Og når vores vers er reciteret til dem som klare beviser, dem, der ikke forventer møde med os siger, "bringe os et Koranen end det eller ændre det." Sige, [O Muhammad], "det er ikke for mig at ændre det på min egen overenskomst. Jeg følger kun, hvad er åbenbaret for mig. Ja jeg er bange for, hvis jeg skulle adlyde min herre, straf af en enorm dag."

trans-unit.source: Say, "If Allah had willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you, for I had remained among you a lifetime before it. Then will you not reason?"
trans-unit.target: Sige, "hvis Allah havde villet, jeg ikke ville have fremsagde det til dig, eller ville han have gjort det kendt til dig, for jeg havde opholdt sig blandt jer livet før det. Derefter vil du ikke grund?"

trans-unit.source: So who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah or denies His signs? Indeed, the criminals will not succeed
trans-unit.target: Så hvem er mere uretfærdig end han, der opfinder en løgn om Allah eller afviser hans tegn? Faktisk, kriminelle vil ikke lykkes

trans-unit.source: And they worship other than Allah that which neither harms them nor benefits them, and they say, "These are our intercessors with Allah " Say, "Do you inform Allah of something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him
trans-unit.target: Og de tilbeder andre end Allah, der hverken skader dem heller ikke gavner dem, og de siger, "Dette er vores forbedere med Allah" siger, "Gør du informere Allah af noget, han ikke kender i himlen eller på jorden?" Ophøjet er han og højt over hvad de forbinder med ham

trans-unit.source: And mankind was not but one community [united in religion], but [then] they differed. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them [immediately] concerning that over which they differ.
trans-unit.target: Og menneskeheden var ikke men én EF [forenet i religion], men [så] de afveg. Og hvis ikke for et ord, der gik forud for fra din Herre, det ville have været bedømt mellem dem [samme] om det, som adskiller de sig.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Why is a sign not sent down to him from his Lord?" So say, "The unseen is only for Allah [to administer], so wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
trans-unit.target: Og de siger, "Hvorfor er et tegn ikke sendt til ham fra hans herre?" Så siger, "usynlige er kun for Allah [at administrere], så vent; Ja, jeg er med dig blandt dem, der vente. "

trans-unit.source: And when We give the people a taste of mercy after adversity has touched them, at once they conspire against Our verses. Say, "Allah is swifter in strategy." Indeed, Our messengers record that which you conspire
trans-unit.target: Og når vi giver folk en smag af barmhjertighed efter modgang har rørt dem, på en gang de konspirerer mod vores vers. Sige, "Allah er hurtigere i strategi". Ja, vores budbringere optage det, som du konspirerer

trans-unit.source: It is He who enables you to travel on land and sea until, when you are in ships and they sail with them by a good wind and they rejoice therein, there comes a storm wind and the waves come upon them from everywhere and they assume that they are surrounded, supplicating Allah, sincere to Him in religion, "If You should save us from this, we will surely be among the thankful."
trans-unit.target: Det er ham, der gør det muligt at rejse på land og hav, indtil, når du befinder dig i skibe og de sejler med dem af en god vind og de fryde sig deri, kommer der en storm vinden og bølgerne falde over dem fra overalt og de antager, at de er omringet, bedende Allah, oprigtig til ham i religion, "Hvis du skal spare os fra denne Vi vil helt sikkert være blandt de taknemmelige. "

trans-unit.source: But when He saves them, at once they commit injustice upon the earth without right. O mankind, your injustice is only against yourselves, [being merely] the enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: Men når han gemmer dem, på en gang de begår uretfærdighed på jorden uden lige. O menneskeheden, din uretfærdighed er kun mod jer [er blot] nydelsen af verdslige liv. Så for os er dit afkast, og vi vil informere dig om hvad du plejede at gøre.

trans-unit.source: The example of [this] worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky that the plants of the earth absorb - [those] from which men and livestock eat - until, when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they have capability over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain in detail the signs for a people who give thought.
trans-unit.target: Eksempel på [denne] verdslige liv men lide regn, som vi har sendt fra himlen at planter af jorden absorbere - [dem] fra hvilke mænd og animalske spiser - indtil, når jorden har taget sin pynt og er forskønnet og dens folk formoder at de har kapacitet over det, der kommer til vores kommando om natten eller dagen , og vi gør det som en høst, som hvis det ikke havde blomstrede i går. Således skal vi forklare i detaljer tegnene for et folk, der overveje.

trans-unit.source: And Allah invites to the Home of Peace and guides whom He wills to a straight path
trans-unit.target: Og Allah opfordrer til hjem af fred og vejledninger, hvem han Testamente til en lige vej

trans-unit.source: For them who have done good is the best [reward] and extra. No darkness will cover their faces, nor humiliation. Those are companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally
trans-unit.target: For dem, der har er gjort godt de bedste [belønning] og ekstra. Intet mørke vil dække deres ansigter, eller ydmygelse. De er kammerater i paradis; de vil overholde deri evigt

trans-unit.source: But they who have earned [blame for] evil doings - the recompense of an evil deed is its equivalent, and humiliation will cover them. They will have from Allah no protector. It will be as if their faces are covered with pieces of the night - so dark [are they]. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
trans-unit.target: Men de, der har tjent [skylden for] onde gerninger - belønning af en ond gerning er tilsvarende, og ydmygelse vil dække dem. De vil have fra Allah ikke protector. Det er som om deres ansigter dækkes med stykker af nat - så mørkt [er de]. De er kammerater i ilden; de vil overholde deri evigt.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will gather them all together - then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, "[Remain in] your place, you and your 'partners.' " Then We will separate them, and their "partners" will say, "You did not used to worship us,
trans-unit.target: Og [omtale, O Muhammad], den dag vi vil samle dem alle sammen - så vi vil sige til dem, der tilknyttet andre Allah, "[fortsat] dit sted, du og din 'partnere." "Så vi vil adskille dem, og deres"partnere"vil sige,"du ikke brugt til at tilbede os,

trans-unit.source: And sufficient is Allah as a witness between us and you that we were of your worship unaware."
trans-unit.target: Og tilstrækkelig er Allah som vidne mellem os og dem, at vi var for din tilbedelse uvidende"

trans-unit.source: There, [on that Day], every soul will be put to trial for what it did previously, and they will be returned to Allah, their master, the Truth, and lost from them is whatever they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: Der, [den dag] er hver sjæl vil blive sat til rettergang for, hvad det gjorde tidligere, og de vil tilbage til Allah, deres master, sandheden, og tabt fra dem hvad de plejede at opfinde.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Or who controls hearing and sight and who brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and who arranges [every] matter?" They will say, "Allah," so say, "Then will you not fear Him?"
trans-unit.target: Sige, "der sørger for dig fra himlen og jorden? Eller Hvem kontrollerer hørelsen og synet og der bringer lever af døde og bringer døde fra levende og der arrangerer [hver] sag?" De vil sige, "Allah," så siger, "så vil du ikke at frygte ham?"

trans-unit.source: For that is Allah, your Lord, the Truth. And what can be beyond truth except error? So how are you averted?
trans-unit.target: For det er Allah, jeres Herre, sandheden. Og hvad kan være mere end sandheden undtagen fejl? Så hvordan er du afværget?

trans-unit.source: Thus the word of your Lord has come into effect upon those who defiantly disobeyed - that they will not believe.
trans-unit.target: Således er din Herrens ord trådt i kraft efter dem, der trodsigt adlød - at de ikke vil tro.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who begins creation and then repeats it?" Say, "Allah begins creation and then repeats it, so how are you deluded?"
trans-unit.target: Sige, "Er der i din 'partnere' enhver der begynder oprettelse og derefter gentager det?" Sige, "Allah begynder oprettelse og derefter gentager det, så hvordan er du fantast?"

trans-unit.source: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth. So is He who guides to the truth more worthy to be followed or he who guides not unless he is guided? Then what is [wrong] with you - how do you judge?"
trans-unit.target: Sige, "Er der i din 'partnere' enhver der guider til sandheden?" Sige, "Allah guides til sandheden. Så er han, der guider til sandheden mere værdig følges eller ham, der guider ikke medmindre han er styret? Så hvad er [forkert] med dig - Hvordan vurderer du?"

trans-unit.source: And most of them follow not except assumption. Indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Og de fleste af dem følger ikke undtagen antagelse. Faktisk, antagelse benytter ikke mod sandheden på alle. Allah er at vide om, hvad de gør.

trans-unit.source: And it was not [possible] for this Qur'an to be produced by other than Allah, but [it is] a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of the [former] Scripture, about which there is no doubt, from the Lord of the worlds.
trans-unit.target: Og det var ikke [mulighed] for denne Koranen at være produceret af andre end Allah, men [det er] en bekræftelse af, hvad der var før det og en detaljeret forklaring af den [tidligere] Skriften, hvorom der er ingen tvivl, fra verdens Herre.

trans-unit.source: Or do they say [about the Prophet], "He invented it?" Say, "Then bring forth a surah like it and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Eller siger de [om profeten], "han opfandt det?" Siger, "så frembringe en Sura som det og opfordrer [for bistand] hvem du kan udover Allah, hvis du skulle være sandfærdig."

trans-unit.source: Rather, they have denied that which they encompass not in knowledge and whose interpretation has not yet come to them. Thus did those before them deny. Then observe how was the end of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Tværtimod har de nægtet at som de omfatter ikke i viden og hvis fortolkning ikke er endnu kommet til dem. Dermed dem før dem benægte. Derefter iagttage hvordan var i slutningen af lovovertrædere.

trans-unit.source: And of them are those who believe in it, and of them are those who do not believe in it. And your Lord is most knowing of the corrupters
trans-unit.target: Og af dem er dem, der tror på det, og af dem er dem, der ikke tror på det. Og din herre er de fleste at vide af corrupters

trans-unit.source: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], then say, "For me are my deeds, and for you are your deeds. You are disassociated from what I do, and I am disassociated from what you do."
trans-unit.target: Og hvis de nægter du, [O Muhammad], så siger, "For mig er mine gerninger, og du er dine gerninger. Du er løsrevet fra, hvad jeg gør, og jeg am adskilles fra, hvad du gør."

trans-unit.source: And among them are those who listen to you. But can you cause the deaf to hear, although they will not use reason?
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem er dem, der lytter til dig. Men kan du give de døve til at høre, selv om de ikke vil bruge årsagen?

trans-unit.source: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind although they will not [attempt to] see?
trans-unit.target: Og blandt dem er dem, der ser på dig. Men kan du guide blinde, selv om de vil ikke [forsøg på at] Se?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who are wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: Faktisk Allah forkerte ikke folk på alle, men det er de mennesker, der gøre sig selv.

trans-unit.source: And on the Day when He will gather them, [it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day, [and] they will know each other. Those will have lost who denied the meeting with Allah and were not guided
trans-unit.target: Og på den dag, hvor han vil samle dem, [man] som om de ikke havde forblev [i verden] men en time af dagen, [og] de vil kende hinanden. De vil have mistet der nÃ¦gtet møde med Allah og blev ikke styret

trans-unit.source: And whether We show you some of what We promise them, [O Muhammad], or We take you in death, to Us is their return; then, [either way], Allah is a witness concerning what they are doing
trans-unit.target: Og uanset om vi viser dig nogle af hvad vi lover dem, [O Muhammad], eller vi tager dig i døden, for os er deres tilbagevenden; [enten måde], Allah er vidne om, hvad de laver

trans-unit.source: And for every nation is a messenger. So when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged
